body.p: Registrere epoastačujuhusa vuostáiváldit ođasreivve ja dieđu go giinu cealká.

Ohcejoga gielda ja Deanu gielda viiddidit dál skuvla- ja mánáidgárdeovttasbarggu riikkarájá rastá. “Dán lahkái mii beassat fállat buoret bálvalusaid iežamet ássiide,” dadjá Deanu gieldda sátnejođiheaddji Frank Ingilæ. “Suoma guovddášeiseválddit oidnet dákkár ovttasbarggu hui dehálažžan”, dadjá Ohcejoga gielddastivrra ságadoalli Veikko Guttorm.

Ohcejohnjálmmi skuvla ja Sirpmá skuvla leat guhkit áigge juo bargan ovttas. Jagi 2005 rájes lea skuvllain leamaš oktasaš oahpahus guokte beaivvi vahkus. Ohcejoga ja Deanu gielddat barget maiddái ovttas mánáidgárdefálaldagas (beaiveruoktofálaldagas). Smávvámánát sáhttet oažžut sámegiel mánáidgárdefálaldaga nuppi riikkas.

Ovttasbarggus rájá rastá nannejuvvo sámegiel máhttu, daningo sámegiella doaibmá lunddolaš gulahallangiellan. Mánát ohppet maiddái bargat riikkaidgaskasaččat. Dát lea dehálaš gelbbolašvuohta globaliserejuvvon máilmmis.

Ohcejoga ja Deanu gielddat ovttas Deanu giellagáttiin áigot dál viiddidit dán ovttasbarggu. Earret eará áigot ođđa prošeaktavirggi bokte bidjat johtui eambbo giellanannendoaimmaid skuvllain ja mánáidgárddiin. Árramánnávuođa bajásgeassima áššedovdi doaimma čadnojuvvo Ohcejoga sámi beaiveruktui (mánáidgárdái). Ohcanáigemearrin lea 6.5.10.

Sosiála- ja dearvvasvuođaministeria lea juolludan Ohcejoga gildii Kaste-prográmma mielde stáhtadoarjaga Deanuleagi sosiála- dearvvasvuođabálvalusaid ovddidanfidnui. Dáinna fidnuin nannejuvvo sosiála- ja dearvvasvuođabálvalusaid doaibman Suoma ja Norgga rájá badjel. Minister Paula Risikko atná dán máŋggabealat ovttasbarggu rájá badjel hui deaŧalažžan.
Loga eambbo prošeavttas “OVTTAS! Sámi giella-, skuvla-, ja mánáidgárdeovddideapmi Deanuleagis" dás .

Excellent take on the situation, Chuck. I coludn"t agree with you more. Maybe maybe this drastic change in Macworld Expo isn"t such a terrible thing. The cost savings and there must be a huge cost savings for Apple seems like a spart business move. With Apple stores all over the world and Apple"s other marketing efforts, do they really need exposure to a relatively small group of people who happen to make it to the show? I"m sure someone can argue that at least 75% of those who attend Macworld Expo are already sold on the Mac. There are four (or maybe five?) Apple stores in Arizona alone. Surely the same number of people pass through those Apple stores in a single day as what pass through the Apple booth at a Macworld Expo during the few days of the show.And here"s one example of how Macworld is hurting Apple I"m desperate for a replacement for my 12 PowerBook. I have a 15 MacBook Pro but want something much smaller and ligher with build in DVD to take on the road. This recent wave of laptops almost convinced me to invest in a 13 PowerBook. Almost. But because Macworld Exp is around the corner and because Apple usually has something new at each show, I decided to wait to see if my dream computer will be released there. If there was no anticipation of a Macworld announcement, I would have bought the new computer last week. (And I am still hopeful that I"ll get my tiny Mac laptop someday.)There"s only one good-sized group that will really suffer from this: medium and small developers. They"re losing out on their opportunity to show off their products to a captive audience. They"re losing the ability to get one-on-one face time with potential customers. All of this was pointed out during the MacJury episode we recorded the other day. It makes good listening for anyone interested in how an insider feels about what"s going on.But there are other ways for developers to get attention for their products and other ways for them to interact with customers. The change or possible demise of Macworld Expo might bring about the dawn of a new day or an evolution style survival of the fittest for developers who depended on Macworld Expo to generate interest in their products.Anyway, good take on the situation. I think I pretty much agree with everything you have to say.

I am so sorry for your loss. Even when you are expecting it, it is still hard. The first week is the haesrdt in my experience. Just try to distract yourself and cry when you need to. Sam was an adorable and cheerful little dude and we all know that you gave him a good life. He was part of your family. My advice is to keep his things but put them out of sight for now. Create a memorial of some kind. My dog Agnes died in October and I still haven"t put together hers but I have photos and her collar to use. Best wishes for you in this difficult time.

It’s also likely to create free glutamates (another name for MS8G)You.217;d be substituting a living, health-promoting food for a dead, harmful food.In my book, it’s just not worth it.
